commit.message:
Add `--use-first-matching-interpreter` (#1008)

Before:
```
1: python -m pex --disable-cache --interpreter-constraint=CPython>=3.6 cryptography -o t.pex
            Mean        Std.Dev.    Min         Median      Max
real        7.541       0.258       7.283       7.378       7.967
user        21.989      0.609       20.890      21.887      23.020
sys         5.979       0.169       5.690       5.918       6.237
```

After:
```
1: python -m pex --disable-cache --use-first-matching-interpreter --interpreter-constraint=CPython>=3.6 cryptography -o t.pex
            Mean        Std.Dev.    Min         Median      Max
real        6.217       0.478       5.820       6.118       7.592
user        11.233      0.349       10.593      11.292      11.751
sys         3.538       0.106       3.305       3.542       3.675
```

This is expected to be particularly useful for Pants, where often have loose interpreter constraints like the default of `>=3.6`. The only time we actually need to build for `>=3.6` is when running `binary`. All other times, we only need the first matching interpreter.

tree 4297fd0d77f34e5a0f4343b47194974c2864cab0
parent b51b340bea8a585a246997071a815d008986d6e3
author Eric Arellano <14852634+Eric-Arellano@users.noreply.github.com> 1595466770 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1595466770 -0700

```
real        7.541       0.258       7.283       7.378       7.967
user        21.989      0.609       20.890      21.887      23.020
```

```
            Mean        Std.Dev.    Min         Median      Max

user        11.233      0.349       10.593      11.292      11.751
sys         3.538       0.106       3.305       3.542       3.675
```

This is expected to be particularly useful for Pants, where often have loose interpreter constraints like the default of `>=3.6`. The only time we actually need to build for `>=3.6` is when running `binary`. All other times, we only need the first matching interpreter.

commit.message:
Add support for resolving --platform locally. (#1000)

Introduce new APIs to get a PythonInterpreter's associated platforms
directly and use this to implement resolution of specified platforms to
local interpreters when possible if --resolve-local-platforms is
specified.

Fixes #996.

commit.message:

This adds a prompt to use --platform explain as a hack to get more
information from a platform parse error. Also add examples to the parse
error message to cover OSX and PyPy covering the other major variants
we support.

commit.message:
Ensure pip download dir is uncontended. (#998)

When pip encounters an existing file during any of its file operations
it prompts for an action if `--exists-action` has not been set. Pex was
supplying a download directory to pip that was degenerate for
interpreters with the same abi and same major and minor versions (e.g.:
2.7.6 and 2.7.18). We ensure the download directory is unique per
interpreter and further configure the `--exists-action` to abort to get
fail fast behavior and smoke out regressions or any remaining issues in
this vein.

Fixes #983

verification.payload:
tree 67b57401ec610b2886b42b2a2b31e97051bc43ba
parent dd0cf31f791cfce77ef29ddc0750985f80135850
author John Sirois <john.sirois@gmail.com> 1594403284 -0600
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1594403284 -0600

Ensure pip download dir is uncontended. (#998)

When pip encounters an existing file during any of its file operations
it prompts for an action if `--exists-action` has not been set. Pex was
supplying a download directory to pip that was degenerate for
interpreters with the same abi and same major and minor versions (e.g.:
2.7.6 and 2.7.18). We ensure the download directory is unique per
interpreter and further configure the `--exists-action` to abort to get
fail fast behavior and smoke out regressions or any remaining issues in
this vein.

Fixes #983

commit.message:
A PEX_EXTRA_SYS_PATH runtime variable. (#989)

If set, we add these path elements to PEX's runtime sys.path.
This allows code in the pex to interact with code outside the
pex (for example, running pytest in a pex on code outside it).

tree 9b6fa173abaf0e6ab9c7013196783072c2e2a95f

A PEX_EXTRA_SYS_PATH runtime variable. (#989)

If set, we add these path elements to PEX's runtime sys.path.
This allows code in the pex to interact with code outside the
pex (for example, running pytest in a pex on code outside it).

commit.message:
use relative paths within wheel cache (#979)

When running pex within a chroot environment, the symlinks generated by pex/pex/resolver.py use the absolute path within the chroot in the path for the symlinks' targets. These symlinks are invalid paths to any program that accesses the wheel cache outside of the chroot. (This was seen within a remote execution environment with Buildfarm.)

Switch to using relative paths for the symlinks.

Fixes #978.

verification.payload:
tree c4cf62b42cf90067a45a2f30aa18001d5c421d5a
parent e2d6bab09f8e9245f608402a904421268223ee58
author Tom Dyas <tom.dyas@gmail.com> 1589845373 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1589845373 -0700

use relative paths within wheel cache (#979)

When running pex within a chroot environment, the symlinks generated by pex/pex/resolver.py use the absolute path within the chroot in the path for the symlinks' targets. These symlinks are invalid paths to any program that accesses the wheel cache outside of the chroot. (This was seen within a remote execution environment with Buildfarm.)

Switch to using relative paths for the symlinks.

Fixes #978.

commit.message:
Fix Tox not finding Python 3.8 on OSX. (#976)

This works, but I can't explain why the prior did not. Moving on with
the fix though since real green is better than the current early exit
green due to not being able to find Python 3.8 and having our tox.ini
configured for `skip_missing_interpreters = True`. Patch that by adding
`--skip-missing-interpreters=false` to our tox invocations in CI.

verification.payload:
tree 791df669089450f5deec4ba6c8b963e7a61835a7
parent a2b9aa47031bd2f42b2cf6445b27e2ca5fc4e69f
author John Sirois <john.sirois@gmail.com> 1589299176 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1589299176 -0700

Fix Tox not finding Python 3.8 on OSX. (#976)

This works, but I can't explain why the prior did not. Moving on with
the fix though since real green is better than the current early exit
green due to not being able to find Python 3.8 and having our tox.ini
configured for `skip_missing_interpreters = True`. Patch that by adding
`--skip-missing-interpreters=false` to our tox invocations in CI.

commit.message:
Restore handling for bad wheel filenames to `.can_add()` (#973)

My previous PR (#965) unintentionally removed handling for invalid wheel names (e.g. `"foo.whl"` or `"foo-bar.whl"`). This PR restores the previous functionality, namely returning `False` for (a subset of) bad wheel filenames.

I made the conservative choice to only reject filenames with < 3 wheel components (matching the previous behavior), but there's a valid argument to made for rejecting wheels with < 5 components, per [PEP 427](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0427/#file-name-convention).

---

Previous implementation: https://github.com/pantsbuild/pex/blob/2f048d8df0dbcebdc24d2355bf58130baa35de0f/pex/environment.py#L221-L225

verification.payload:
tree eb585499a141e5e958f69e06e402d0d81c62b975
parent a2fc24511677905d18840527c554cc513e790b28
author Jeremy Lewis <luislew@gmail.com> 1589233481 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1589233481 -0700

Restore handling for bad wheel filenames to `.can_add()` (#973)

My previous PR (#965) unintentionally removed handling for invalid wheel names (e.g. `"foo.whl"` or `"foo-bar.whl"`). This PR restores the previous functionality, namely returning `False` for (a subset of) bad wheel filenames.

I made the conservative choice to only reject filenames with < 3 wheel components (matching the previous behavior), but there's a valid argument to made for rejecting wheels with < 5 components, per [PEP 427](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0427/#file-name-convention).

---

Previous implementation: https://github.com/pantsbuild/pex/blob/2f048d8df0dbcebdc24d2355bf58130baa35de0f/pex/environment.py#L221-L225

commit.message:
Fix wheel filename parsing in PEXEnvironment.can_add (#965)

This PR updates `PEXEnvironment.can_add` to split the whole wheel filename in order to gather up the trailing three tags. The previous implementation was overly naive and failed when a wheel filename included a (valid) build tag.

Fixes: #964

verification.payload:
tree 74a5997b49eb4a5ab462c3f2327acd26d5a2e165
parent 53230ea55228c618b70c8548e70f110dbfe0e77a
author Jeremy Lewis <luislew@gmail.com> 1589220494 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1589220494 -0700

Fix wheel filename parsing in PEXEnvironment.can_add (#965)

This PR updates `PEXEnvironment.can_add` to split the whole wheel filename in order to gather up the trailing three tags. The previous implementation was overly naive and failed when a wheel filename included a (valid) build tag.

Fixes: #964

commit.message:
Split Pex resolve API. (#970)

This change introduces download and install APIs that the existing Pex
resolve / resolve_multi APIs are composed from.

The new APIs will be used by Pants to split traditional resolution
(download in Pip terms) from compilation and install of wheels from the
downloaded distributions.

In the future the APIs could be used to support Pex CLI subcommands that
distinguish these two phases of creating a PEX allowing resolution on
one machine and building on another; thus adding a new way to handle
creation of multi-platform pexes without resorting to pre-built wheel
repositories.

verification.payload:
tree 59742d0bc510751641388fc5fff996de6f8b2be5
parent 17c4a6e23fc5b80c9040754e730e2f3c382598a4
author John Sirois <john.sirois@gmail.com> 1589220232 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1589220232 -0700

Split Pex resolve API. (#970)

This change introduces download and install APIs that the existing Pex
resolve / resolve_multi APIs are composed from.

The new APIs will be used by Pants to split traditional resolution
(download in Pip terms) from compilation and install of wheels from the
downloaded distributions.

In the future the APIs could be used to support Pex CLI subcommands that
distinguish these two phases of creating a PEX allowing resolution on
one machine and building on another; thus adding a new way to handle
creation of multi-platform pexes without resorting to pre-built wheel
repositories.

commit.message:
Add a `--local` mode for packaging the Pex PEX. (#971)

This significantly speeds up `--server` launch for local integration
testing when there are many local interpreters that match Pex
requires-python.

tree 085e67e5343ad126b554bee0bfc502cd31ca9175

Add a `--local` mode for packaging the Pex PEX. (#971)

testing when there are many local interpreters that match Pex
requires-python.

commit.message:
Constrain the virtualenv version used by tox. (#968)

Pin virtualenv just under 20.0.5 which is broken for Pex tests when run
under Python 2.7.

Along the way, tidy up tox tool installation by doing it in its own
venv.

Also document, update and align all Python versions used in the various
shards while killing use of pyenv shims.

Finally, kill no longer needed (and unwittingly unused) OSX specific env
vars intended to help pyenv compile ssl libs.

Fixes #967

verification.payload:
tree ab241a76b39658da030d7efbd13662b8bfa777f3
parent 916e61e04634c60d09ee25859c76ba4f27282e51
author John Sirois <john.sirois@gmail.com> 1589217038 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1589217038 -0700

Constrain the virtualenv version used by tox. (#968)

Pin virtualenv just under 20.0.5 which is broken for Pex tests when run
under Python 2.7.

Along the way, tidy up tox tool installation by doing it in its own
venv.

Also document, update and align all Python versions used in the various
shards while killing use of pyenv shims.

Finally, kill no longer needed (and unwittingly unused) OSX specific env
vars intended to help pyenv compile ssl libs.

Fixes #967

commit.message:
Improve Pex packaging. (#961)

Add output of the packaged Pex sha256 hash and its size. Also add a new
serve tox environment for packaging a Pex PEX and wheel and then serving
them over http. The latter is useful for testing Pex with downstream
consumers like Pants.

serve tox environment for packaging a Pex PEX and wheel and then serving
them over http. The latter is useful for testing Pex with downstream
consumers like Pants.

commit.message:
Fix runtime resolve error message generation. (#955)

PR #828 introduced a bug in the code that gathers the
requirers of requirements that failed to be resolved
(so that we can display those requirers in an error message.)

Specifically, reqs_by_key's values are lists of requirements,
so we need to call update() on each such value separately.

verification.payload:
tree fac9b80351875e4f7ae9ae4c38567f8ed75bc5d3
parent d785e34c0f7e31cc6b40a2d7d86883910798a100
author Benjy Weinberger <benjyw@gmail.com> 1587001644 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1587001644 -0700

Fix runtime resolve error message generation. (#955)

PR #828 introduced a bug in the code that gathers the
requirers of requirements that failed to be resolved
(so that we can display those requirers in an error message.)

Specifically, reqs_by_key's values are lists of requirements,
so we need to call update() on each such value separately.
